If people don’t like Common Core, fine. Just make sure the standards that you have are higher than the ones you had before. We can’t keep dumbing down standards.

In recent years, there has been a troubling trend of the U.S. Department of Education increasingly trying to dictate how children are educated in our primary and secondary schools. This must stop and Common Core must be overturned.
Nationally, I do think it’s a good idea to have some kind of standard testing—some parameters to see how everyone’s doing at various grade levels.
It's now been five years since Common Core was adopted. And the truth is that it's simply not working. Instead of solving problems in our classrooms, it is creating new ones.

When I think about the really unfortunate argument that’s been going on around Common Core, it’s very painful, because the Common Core started off as a bi-partisan effort — it was actually nonpartisan.
Instead of a federal government that seeks to dictate school curriculum through Common Core, imagine repealing every word of Common Core.
Our education system is a big problem. When a Washington bureaucracy gets involved in a program, it becomes heavy-handed and standardized. It's how Washington bureaucracy works.
Developing basic math skills is a core component of academic success.
The Obama Administration has effectively bribed and coerced states into adopting Common Core. Blanket education standards should not be a prerequisite for federal funding.
It has morphed into a frankenstandard that nobody, including me, can support.
We want out of Common Core.
I’m not going to change my position because there’s four people in the front row yelling at me.

Our goal moving forward is to build the best public school system in not just America, but in the world. That's why we're choosing to adopt the Common Core standards, new curricula that will prepare our kids to be winners in a global economy, which is growing more knowledge-based by the day.

Common Core is a horrible idea. It’s exactly like Obamacare. You have a bunch of people sitting in a faraway place in Washington who think they are smarter than we are, who are going to dictate to every community in this country how they educate their child. That’s not America. So Common Core should go.
I don’t think there’s really a constitutional role for the federal government in education. So I’m not for a national curriculum.

It’s a 10th Amendment issue.  If you want Washington, if you want to implement their standards, that’s your call.  In Texas we had higher standards.  We had higher standards than No Child Left Behind.  We certainly had higher standards than (Common Core) so it was a very easy decision for Texans, myself and the Legislature included, to basically say we still believe that Texans know how to best run Texas.
The Department of Education, like every federal agency, will never be satisfied. They will not stop with [Common Core] being a suggestion. They will turn it into a mandate.

Put parents back in charge, not the government. Back in 2012, I wasn't for Common Core. And today, I'm still not for Common Core.
I think that for people in Washington to be setting curriculum and to be setting all sorts of standards for people living in Iowa and other places is ridiculous.
I call on the members of the state Legislature to pass legislation making it crystal clear that no school district in the state is required to use Common Core standards.
Let’s put a priority on fixing our educational system, and in the process giving our young people the priorities in our society and the future that they deserve.
